Proposal for Founding DFRK Supported 
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK) is the most just and realistic one for Korea's reunification as it reflected the situation on the divided Korean Peninsula and the aspiration of all the Koreans. The Arab Lawyers Union said this in a statement released on Sept. 26 on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of the proposal for founding the DFRK.
 The statement said that this year marks the 25th anniversary of the above-said proposal laid down by eternal President of the Korean people Kim Il Sung, noting that it is commanding the unanimous support from all Koreans in the north and the south and overseas.    
 Korea should be reunified in the near future on the principle of independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity free from any interference of outside forces in accordance with the proposal for founding the DFRK, the statement noted, and went on: 
 We have always supported the Korean people in their just cause for achieving the country's reunification and defending peace on the Korean Peninsula and held that the U.S. forces pull out of south Korea, as desired and demanded by the Korean nation.

WPK Birthday to Be Observed in Ireland 
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The Irish preparatory committee to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) was inaugurated in Dublin on Sept. 29.
 Seon Garland, president of the Irish Workers' Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Swiss Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by a delegation of the Swiss Committee for Supporting Korea's Independent and Peaceful Reunification on a visit to the DPRK. 
 It was handed to an official concerned by Chairman of the Swiss committee Martin Lotscher who is heading the delegation.

DPRK Delegation Returns from Cuba, Venezuela
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation headed by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, came back Wednesday after visiting Cuba and Venezuela. 
 It was met at the airport by Choe Yong Rim, secretary general of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, Cuban Charge d' Affaires in Pyongyang Caridad Adela Galan Pelegrino and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe.    
 The delegation left Caracas on Oct. 2 after visiting Venezuela.
